title: How many presidents have had more than 2 terms? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: One. FDR was elected four times. He died shortly after the fourth term started. The constitution was amended during Truman’s term so that Presidents can serve a maximum of ten years. Truman was grandfathered in, so could have run for a third term, but decided not to. Lyndon Johnson and Gerald Ford could, theoretically, have served more than two terms. Johnson served 14 months after a Kennedy was killed, and then served a four year term. He decided not to run again. Ford serve a little under two years when Nixon resigned, making him eligible to run for two more terms. However, he lost to Jimmy Carter. Teddy Roosevelt tried. He served almost four years after McKinley was shot, then got elected for four more years. He stepped down, and Taft became president. Roosevelt didn’t like the job he was doing, so ran against Taft as a third party candidate. Taft and Roosevelt split the a Republican vote, and Wilson was elected.

One. Franklin Delano Roosevelt (January 30, 1882 – April 12, 1945), often referred to by his initials FDR, served as 32nd President of the United States from 1933 until 1945. Roosevelt, a Democrat, won a record four presidential elections. After his death in 1945, his fourth term was served out by Harry S Truman.
